titleStmt.title: Antidote against purgatory. Or discourse, wherein is shewed that good-workes, and almes-deeds, performed in the name of Christ, are a chiefe meanes for the preuenting, or migatating the torments of purgatory. Written by that vertuous, and rightworthy gentle-woman (the honour of her sexe for learning in England) Ms. Iane Owen, late of God-stow, in Oxfordshire, deceased, and now published after her death
titleStmt.author: Owen, Jane, of God-stow.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and printer from STC.
Some print show-through; some pages marked and stained.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
